data.text:
Get ready for an unforgettable few months filled with incredible live music at The Trusts Arena! Check out a few of the incredible acts we will be hosting very soon: üìÖ Upcoming Concerts: P1Harmony ‚Äì July 16th Deep Hard N Funky ‚Äì July 20th Garba with Kinjal Dave ‚Äì July 27th B Praak ‚Äì August 9th Deyunshe Cross Talk Show ‚Äì September 12th Yo Yo Honey Singh - September 14th DNB Allstars - September 21st UB40 - October 10th Eden Fest - October 12th Public Enemy - October 15th üéüÔ∏è Tickets are selling fast for these events! Visit our website for more information on each event. üîówww.thetrustsarena.co.nz

Michael Ocego and Samantha Norris have returned from TheStadiumBusiness Summit, and have shared some excellent learnings during their time in the UK: 1. Key discussions focused on the role of connectivity in enhancing the tech-driven fan experience, innovative uses for underutilised spaces, the rising importance of food and beverage, and creative strategies to transform stadiums into year-round venues. The increasing impact of AI on fan engagement and stadium security was also a major highlight. 2. Globally, one of the most effective diversification strategies for stadiums has been the addition of hotels, as illustrated by insights from Daniel Gidney, CEO of Emirates Old Trafford and Lancs Cricket, Tynecastle Park Hotel, and Adelaide Oval. Notably, the hotel's revenue is projected to surpass that of international cricket at the venue for the first time this year. 3. The conference was highly focused on engaging attendees and exploring ways for venues to streamline operations while enhancing the overall experience. For The Trusts Arena, several new initiatives inspired by the conference will be unveiled in the coming months. 4. Lastly, the event was a platform to celebrate our awards finalists, including our own Samantha Norris, who was honoured as a finalist in the ‚ÄòUnsung Hero‚Äô category. Narrowed down to 5 finalists from 755 applications, Sam's recognition is a significant achievement, and although she didn't win, The Trusts Arena team is immensely proud of her. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Presenting our new Gym Manager, Jordan! We are thrilled to announce that Jordan has stepped into the role of Gym Manager for Arena Fitness. You may already know Jordan from his time as our Assistant Gym Manager and as a dedicated Personal Trainer. His commitment to fitness and passion for helping our members achieve their goals have always stood out, and we are excited to see him bring that same energy and enthusiasm to his new role. Please join us in congratulating Jordan and showing him your support as he begins his new role at Arena Fitness.
